oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE CRADLE OF PORT ENGINEERING IN VENTOTENE ISLAND
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Franco, Leopoldo
Graauw, Arthur de
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The island of Ventotene (Pandaria, in Latin), located about 50 km from southern Lazio coasts, holds a special world record, highly esteemed by maritime engineers: it preserves almost intact and fully functional one of the oldest and most beautiful ports, the Roman port, built by emperor Augustus in 14 BC, over 2000 years ago, to accommodate ships up to 30 m in length. The port is still used today in its original form and is preferred over the adjacent modern port by the tourist and fishing fleet. The plan layout of the port is very modern (almost specular to that of new port of Gioia Tauro, though with much smaller size), ensuring calm conditions in all weather. The port layout has a narrow entrance open to the sea to the east (easily navigable and visible at night), followed by a cove with a gently sloping beach that absorbs the waves and allows the hauling of small boats. On the side, there is a well protected elongated rectangular mooring basin.
